content: If I have a common subexpression which appears in many different places in my proof, how can I substitute it with a common variable? For instance, if I have (a+b)/2 in different areas of my codebase, I would like to do let mid := (a+b)/2 and have all appearances of (a+b)/2 substituted with mid. I have "loogled" for substitute, rename and fold (since it's opposite of unfold), but they don't seem to fit my usecase.
I feel like I should have found this sooner. Is there a glosary of tactics or a proper way to search for them? Because I couldn't find it at all, and it now seems to be pretty basic
And what is the opposite of set? Because unfold doesn't seem to be working for me, it says unknown constant 'mid'
Or use set x := .. with hx and rewrite with hx
